text.516: there are the sierra de gredos if one leaves here .
text.518: “ i am tired of being hunted .
text.520: now if you blow a bridge here , we will be hunted .
text.521: if they know we are here and hunt for us with planes , they will find us .
text.522: if they send moors to hunt us out , they will find us and we must go .
text.523: i am tired of all this .
text.526: “ what right have you , a foreigner , to come to me and tell me what i must do ?
text.527: ” “ i have not told you anything you must do , ” robert jordan said to him .
text.531: ” he pointed at the two heavy packs that they had lowered to the ground while they had watched the horses .
text.532: seeing the horses had seemed to bring this all to a head in him and seeing that robert jordan knew horses had seemed to loosen his tongue .
text.533: the three of them stood now by the rope corral and the patchy sunlight shone on the coat of the bay stallion .
text.534: pablo looked at him and then pushed with his foot against the heavy pack .
text.536: ” “ i come only for my duty , ” robert jordan told him .
text.537: “ i come under orders from those who are conducting the war .
text.538: if i ask you to help me , you can refuse and i will find others who will help me .
text.539: i have not even asked you for help yet .
text.540: i have to do what i am ordered to do and i can promise you of its importance .
text.541: that i am a foreigner is not my fault .
text.542: i would rather have been born here .
text.543: ” “ to me , now , the most important is that we be not disturbed here , ” pablo said .
text.544: “ to me , now , my duty is to those who are with me and to myself .
text.547: “ thyself now since a long time .
text.549: until thou hadst horses thou wert with us .
text.550: now thou art another capitalist more .
text.552: “ i expose the horses all the time for the cause .
text.559: ” “ you are an old man who will make himself trouble with his mouth .
text.560: ” “ i am an old man who is afraid of no one , ” anselmo told him .
text.561: “ also i am an old man without horses .
text.562: ” “ you are an old man who may not live long .
text.563: ” “ i am an old man who will live until i die , ” anselmo said .
text.564: “ and i am not afraid of foxes .
text.565: ” pablo said nothing but picked up the pack .
text.566: “ nor of wolves either , ” anselmo said , picking up the other pack .
text.568: ” “ shut thy mouth , ” pablo said to him .
text.569: “ thou art an old man who always talks too much .
text.570: ” “ and would do whatever he said he would do , ” anselmo said , bent under the pack .

text.575: ” it is starting badly enough , robert jordan thought .
text.577: they are wonderful when they are good , he thought .
text.578: there is no people like them when they are good and when they go bad there is no people that is worse .
text.579: anselmo must have known what he was doing when he brought us here .
text.581: i don’t like any of it .
text.582: the only good sign was that pablo was carrying the pack and that he had given him the carbine .
text.583: perhaps he is always like that , robert jordan thought .
text.584: maybe he is just one of the gloomy ones .
text.585: no , he said to himself , don’t fool yourself .
text.586: you do not know how he was before; but you do know that he is going bad fast and without hiding it .
text.587: when he starts to hide it he will have made a decision .
text.589: the first friendly thing he does , he will have made a decision .
text.590: they are awfully good horses , though , he thought , beautiful horses .
text.591: i wonder what could make me feel the way those horses make pablo feel .
text.593: the horses made him rich and as soon as he was rich he wanted to enjoy life .
text.594: pretty soon he’ll feel bad because he can’t join the jockey club , i guess , he thought .
text.597: that idea made him feel better .
text.598: he grinned , looking at the two bent backs and the big packs ahead of him moving through the trees .
text.599: he had not made any jokes with himself all day and now that he had made one he felt much better .
text.600: you’re getting to be as all the rest of them , he told himself .
text.602: he’d certainly been solemn and gloomy with golz .
text.603: the job had overwhelmed him a little .
text.606: golz was gay and he had wanted him to be gay too before he left , but he hadn’t been .
text.607: all the best ones , when you thought it over , were gay .
text.608: it was much better to be gay and it was a sign of something too .
text.609: it was like having immortality while you were still alive .
text.611: there were not many of them left though .
text.612: no , there were not many of the gay ones left .
text.613: there were very damned few of them left .
text.614: and if you keep on thinking like that , my boy , you won’t be left either .
text.615: turn off the thinking now , old timer , old comrade .
